result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey A Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joey A Hale

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 9:15 AM Defendant Joey A Hale in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Joey A Hale.

11:43 AM Defendant Joey A Hale appeared by video, in custody, from Waupaca County.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Joey A Hale. 
Attorney Knaapen reviews history of case. He was sentenced to one year jail on a revocation of probation on another case. He is asking that bond be modified to cash bond. Attorney Nolan Plutchak asks that bond remain the same.
Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond is continued.
Bail/bond hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:19 AM Defendant Joey A Hale in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Joey A Hale. 
John Matthews is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a sergeant with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 3/3/22, he executed a search warrant in the Town of Rudolph. The defendant was present in the residence along with other people. He testifies as to drug paraphernalia and drugs that were found in the residence and garage. The substances tested positive for methamphetamine. A firearm was also found in the garage. He states the amount of methamphetamine indicated that it was intended to be distributed. Defendant is a convicted felon and is not allowed to possess a firearm. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Nolan Plutchak cross-examines witness. 
Attorney Knaapen asks Court to take judicial notice of Portage County case 17CF20, a felony conviction. Court takes judicial notice.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea to all counts. Bond is continued.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  $10,000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
9:17 AM Defendant Joey A Hale appeared by video, in custody. Emily Nolan Plutchak in court for Joey Hale  Attorney Craig Lambertin court for State of Wisconsin.
